title: Bad routing with Time Warner Cable
body:
Location - Lincoln, Nebraska
ISP - Time Warner Cable
Hey, ever since the Chicago server move I have always hovered around 50-60 ping which doesn't seem quite right considering Chicago isn't too far from southeast Nebraska. Also, most of my friends play on ~28-30 ping on different isps when connecting to the Chicago servers. So, I figured this must be a routing issue with TWC and found out I'm being routed through Texas first, to get to Chicago. I was wondering how I could get this resolved, or if a rioter could help me notify twc of the issue, thanks! 

Here is the trace route:
Tracing route to 104.160.131.1 over a maximum of 30 hops

  1    10 ms     1 ms     5 ms  192.168.0.1
  2    30 ms    28 ms    28 ms  cpe-97-98-224-1.neb.res.rr.com [97.98.224.1]
  3    32 ms    30 ms    37 ms  tge0-0-13.lnclnebt01h.neb.rr.com [76.85.221.65]
  4    24 ms    28 ms    28 ms  agg20.lnclnebt01r.neb.rr.com [24.169.242.20]
  5    44 ms    37 ms    38 ms  agg31.dllatxl301r.texas.rr.com [24.169.242.0]
  6    39 ms    42 ms    48 ms  bu-ether14.dllstx976iw-bcr00.tbone.rr.com [66.109.6.88]
  7    34 ms    38 ms    38 ms  0.ae0.pr1.dfw10.tbone.rr.com [107.14.17.232]
  8    39 ms    36 ms    40 ms  24.27.236.233
  9    32 ms    38 ms    35 ms  104.160.134.35
 10    65 ms    67 ms    58 ms  ae35-br02.chi01.riotdirect.net [104.160.159.24]
 11    56 ms    58 ms    58 ms  ae1-br01.chi01.riotdirect.net [104.160.159.8]
 12    67 ms    53 ms    61 ms  104.160.131.1

Trace complete.

replies.body: It sounds weird that your network would be routing in the opposite direction just to get back to the game server.  I recommend contacting your ISP ans sharing the insight you've found through the traceroute.  Specifically, I recommend using [WinMTR](http://winmtr.net/winmtr-v0-92-now-available/) instead, which will paint a better picture of what's happening.  They should be able to investigate this further and help!  Good luck!
